results.name: Training and Development Facilitator
results.contents:
As a member of the Talent Management team, develop, coordinate and deliver workshops and other training on a variety of topics to Appian employees.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct training needs analysis and define learning goals to support development

  • Identify or develop training curricula, instructor manuals, learner guides, and other materials to the most current evidence-based practices in the subject of the program

  • Organize, publicize, and recruit audience for participation in employee development programs

  • Facilitate formal and informal workshops and learning experiences for large and small groups

    • Deliver engaging, actionable training

    • Effectively handle challenging classroom situations

    • Provide organizational context efficiently intertwined with course content

  • Help learners be successful in practicing the skills both in the classroom and back on the job

  • Compile tests and other evaluations to be used to measure learning and performance as a result of learning initiatives

  • Coordinate or perform administrative functions necessary to deliver and document learning and development programs including methods to track progress of participants and program scheduling

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required; Master’s degree in Communication, Education, Adult Education, or related field preferred

  • 4+ years of professional training experience in a fast paced environment

  • Knowledge of adult learning theory and employee development methods including instructor-led and virtual classroom delivery

  • Strong written and oral communication skills including presentation and facilitation skills

  • Experience delivering soft skills training to various levels of employees


#LI-MT1

results.name: Multi-Site Leasing Consultant - Northern Virginia (Reston, Falls Church & Fairfax)
results.contents:
Bozzuto Management Company is seeking a self-driven professional to join our award-winning team as an Multi-Site Leasing Consultant at a Bozzuto managed community. From day one you will be highly involved in showcasing the community and creating great experiences for prospective and current residents to ensure they have an amazing place to call home.

Joining Bozzuto as a Multi-Site Leasing Consultant is the first step toward a leadership role within the company. You will gain invaluable business, sales, and customer service/relationship building experience, and the opportunity to thrive and grow in the real estate and hospitality industries.

Expected Contributions:

  • Deliver timely and remarkable customer service to community residents.
  • Generate new leases and conduct tours of the apartment community.
  • Assist with innovative strategies that build positive buzz and key connections.
  • Support efforts to partner with nearby businesses, events, and other local organizations.
  • Help create engaging social media initiatives to connect residents, and manage posts.
  • Play a key role in resolving resident concerns and issues.



Required Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.
  • Proven track-record of providing excellent sales and customer service.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms, as well as best practices for businesses.

Additional Requirements:

To perform the duties of a Multi-Site Leasing Consultant, you must have the ability to work some weekends from 10:00am to 5:00pm on both Saturday and Sunday—while still enjoying two days off each week.

Bozzuto's mission is to create the best possible living environment for our customers and to do so in a way that creates community and respects the world in which we live. From the very beginning, our success has been built around our four core values:

  1. Concern - for the communities we touch.
  2. Creativity - in everything we do.
  3. Passion - in our approach to business.
  4. Perfection - as a goal worth pursuing.

Supporting these values is a set of beliefs or practices that guide us in how we do business and conduct ourselves on a daily basis.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer EOE/M/F/D/V.

results.name: Senior Salesforce Certified Administrator
results.contents:
Senior Salesforce Certified Administrator

The Senior Salesforce Administrator is primarily responsible for the operation, administration, requirements and technical support for of the Salesforce.com production environment. The Senior Salesforce Administrator will understand and proactively monitor all aspects of the Salesforce configuration and technical and functional capabilities, execute all configuration changes related to the Salesforce release upgrades, work with third-party integrations, and support business initiatives with optimized reporting and dashboards. A successful candidate will identify new and creative opportunities to leverage Salesforce.com to support improved business processes and will be motivated, team-oriented and passionate about Salesforce technology.

The ideal candidate possesses these personality traits necessary to succeed:

1. Tenacity: Takes the initiative, actively, to solve problems themselves without help and with a high degree of success. The candidate is someone that will not wait for work to be assigned to them, rather will find and solve problems on their own and seeks out ways to make the client’s systems more efficient, more user-friendly, and more secure.

2. Credibility: Should do their homework and know what they are talking about at all times. The candidate should seek out knowledge about the assigned systems actively and be able to read/understand documentation and historical knowledge bases to draw their own expert understanding of the systems in order to be a trusted advisor to the client.

3. Consistency: The candidate is present at all meetings, is prepared for them and is active in them. The candidate is available during the client’s working hours on a consistent and reliable basis. The candidate responds to calls, instant messages, and electronic mails immediately and has a base instinct about perception management with regard to client interaction and with management.

Position Responsibilities

  • Functional knowledge of Salesforce.com data structure and understanding of how to leverage the tool to meet complex process and reporting requirements
  • Knowledgeable with force.com, sales cloud, service cloud
  • Identify, develop and deliver reports and dashboards
  • Create and manage all Salesforce.com reporting and dashboard functions
  • Maintain security for Salesforce.com data
  • Manage security, users, roles, profiles, groups, queues, sharing rules and other setup options
  • Monitor Salesforce.com usage for compliance
  • Prepare data files and uploads the data into Salesforce.com using the data loader and other 3rd party tools
  • Manage process to deploy updates, enhancements, and new system functionality including the creation of custom objects, custom formulas, scalable triggers, and workflows
  • Manage outsourced Salesforce.com implementation partners as required
  • Define, communicate, and manage a Change Management (release) process to develop and implement new applications and updates to existing applications
  • Provide technical support
  • Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Salesforce.com
  • Share best practices with team members to enhance the quality and efficiency of customer support and contributes to the knowledge base
  • Develop reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity
  • Provide the management team with activity dashboards as needed applications and the user interface using Salesforce.com programming languages
  • Extend third-party product and platform integrations and their dependencies on Salesforce.com
  • Lead Salesforce.com user training
  • Develop on the platform as necessary
  • Research integration issues and work closely with team members on operations and development staff
  • Research and development of new Salesforce.com prototypes and applications
  • Document best practices and operational procedures
  • Research and keep current on force.com technologies and communicates trends and future needs from a business perspective
  • Produce and improve overall documentation related to configuration and deployment of applications
  • Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of applications
  • Monitor Help Desk ticketing system and e-mail for incoming tickets and updates to existing tickets
  • Build client trust and respect, establish client relationships, and develop rapport with client
  • Participate and engage in all team meetings
  • Facilitate continuous improvement within the environment

Position Requirements

Minimum 5 years of experience with Salesforce.com administration and/or implementation, encompassing the following:

  • Defining the security model for organizations, roles, groups, profiles and field-level access
  • Deep understanding of Salesforce.com technical requirements, system configuration, user requirements and all related policies and procedures
  • Experience with custom reporting, modifying pages, views and dashboards
  • Experience working with Salesforce Community portals
  • Experience with Force.com development
  • Experience working with workflows and triggers to automate tasks
  • Ability to introduce new Salesforce elements, processes, procedures
  • Knowledge of databases and proficiency in data manipulation and cleaning
  • Must have historical and proven knowledge and practical application of the Salesforce.com design, logic rules and execution of Salesforce.com configuration changes
  • Experience with database software, Platform as a Service solutions
  • Ability to work on multiple tasks and deliver results with aggressive timelines
  • Able and willing to work independently and in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, with minimal supervision
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, as well as excellent communication skills, verbal and written to both technical and non-technical audiences that are in a geographically dispersed environment (conference calls, Skype, face-to-face)
  • Ability to speak and write English fluently, and can produce high quality technical documentation and analysis
  • Take initiative to recommend process improvements and demonstrate creative thinking
  • Demonstrate self motivation and the ability to grasp concepts quickly
  • Demonstrate sharp, analytical, problem solving, and decision making skills
  • Knowledge of related applications, relational databases, and web technology
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies
  • Experience with Help Desk Ticketing systems
  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent work experience
  • Certified Salesforce Administrator (ADM201)

results.name: HR Generalist
results.contents:
Job Description

Are you eager to use your HR expertise, people skills, and analytical prowess at a place where you can have a huge impact? We’re on the hunt for a dynamic HR Generalist to support Atlassians and People Leaders in our Manila office. In close partnership with the Global HR Business Partner team, you will deliver on our global people priorities and operational plan. In this role you will work closely with our central HR functions to deliver solutions to your clients. As the sole HR Generalist based in Manila, you'll have the chance to demonstrate significant initiative, engage your curiosity and desire to challenge the status quo in favor of new and better ways of doing things.

Atlassian is a distributed and matrixed organisation which means that you will collaborate with team members all over the world and partner with multiple functions. In this environment you will use your communication and collaboration skills to find answers and solve problems. Responsibilities of this role will include partnering with our HR Ops team to respond to all day to day HR queries in Manila; support Atlassians and People Managers through core HR processes and programs (e.g. performance management and employee engagement surveys); recommend and implement relevant local HR processes and policies; coach People Leaders through performance management and employee relations cases while keeping our Atlassian values front of mind; and deliver people related training programs.

More about you

On your first day, we'll expect you to have:

  • 4+ years of experience in human resources, with a deep understanding of relevant Philippines labor laws and issues
  • Ability to build relationships with coworkers at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to design creative solutions to improve our People operations and processes
  • Interest in working both on day-to-day HR tasks and special projects

More about the team

On the Atlassian HR team, we use an analytical, data-driven approach to solve problems, build programs, and help Atlassians constantly improve upon how they work. In this role, you’ll work with a team that partners with business and technology teams to ensure our employees are innovating at their peak, leading teams and guiding their amazing people.

To learn more about working with the People Team at Atlassian, see our Business Team page!

Atlassian. Powered by You.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

results.name: Associate Real Estate Agent - (Avon, Plainfield, Greenwood areas of Indiana)
results.contents:
Redfin is a new kind of real estate brokerage that puts clients first, making buying and selling a home faster, easier, and more efficient. We believe that real estate should be built on exceptional client service and advocacy. Whether finding the perfect home or getting the best deal, our clients are the backbone of everything we do.

As a Redfin Associate Agent, you are an independent contractor who conducts field events for our deal-writing agents’ clients. You will be paid per event, including home tours and open houses. You own your own schedule and you can work as much or as little as you'd like, provided we've got the demand in your area.

Who You Are

  • Fire in the belly: you’re excited to change the industry for the better and you come to work every day ready to go
  • Ethical: you always do the right thing
  • Real estate chops: you're a licensed agent ready to hang your license with us
  • Tech-savvy: you love technology - you're addicted to email, social media, and your smart phone
  • Customer-focused: you’re a customer advocate, a diplomat, and you always keep it professional
  • Intelligent: you are articulate and can communicate clearly. You think on your feet and you're quick to react to clients' changing needs
  • Local knowledge: you know your community like the back of your hand
  • Prompt: you’re on the ball. Early is on time

What You’ll Need

  • A reliable mode of transportation
  • A real estate license or the willingness to acquire one as well as joining the local MLS
  • A smart phone, a laptop, and a GPS - or the willingness to get them

Redfin is an equal opportunity employer.
 
IND123

results.name: Senior Billing Systems Analyst
results.contents:
Job Duties & Responsibilities
GEICO – a proven online, mobile and industry leader -- The IT Billing Payment department seeks a highly motivated candidate to join the IT Billing Payments team as a Senior Billing Systems Analyst. We are utilizing emerging technologies to drive results, enhance customer online experiences, and impact bottom line results. As a Senior Billing Systems Analyst, you must possess proven systems analysis skills, experience producing complex requirements and designs, and have the ability to work independently with the development team and the business user community.

The ideal candidate will have Exceed Billing and Payments experience, excellent research, analytical, project management, critical thinking, decision making and problem solving skills. In addition, knowledge and experience with Agile software development methodology is preferred. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of application analysis and design experience.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Develop system requirements for billing projects
  • Perform analysis on the billing system
  • Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to interact effectively with management, business users, developers and team members
  • Proven analytical research and problem solving skills
  • Ability to multitask and maintain an organized work environment and the ability to be a team player and self-starter
  • Strong interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Knowledge of financial concepts is a plus
  • Experience documenting business and system requirements, processes, workflows and test plans is desired
  • Experience with planning and execution of the testing efforts including, development of test cases, coordination between technical and business resources, and documentation on testing results
  • Use Case development and elaboration
  • Understanding of Agile Methodology

Candidate Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field
  • At least 3-5 years of application analysis and design experience (might want to include “financial”)
  • Strong computer skills, including Excel and some SAS or SQL programming knowledge
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to interact effectively with management, business users, developers and team members
  • Proven analytical research and problem solving skills
  • Ability to multitask and maintain an organized work environment
  • Ability to be a team player and self-starter
  • Strong interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Knowledge of billing concepts is desired

About GEICO

For more than 75 years, GEICO has stood out from the rest of the insurance industry! We are one of the nation's largest and fastest-growing auto insurers thanks to our low rates, outstanding service and clever marketing. We're an industry leader employing thousands of dedicated and hard-working associates. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway, we offer associates training and career advancement in a financially stable and rewarding workplace.

Our associates' quality of life is important to us. Full-time GEICO associates are offered a comprehensive Total Rewards Program*, including:

  • 401(k) and profit-sharing plans
  • Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
  • Paid vacation, holidays and leave programs
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Associate assistance program
  • Flexible spending accounts
  • Business casual dress
  • Fitness and dining facilities (at most locations)
  • Associate clubs and sports teams
  • Volunteer opportunities

  • GEICO Federal Credit Union

  • Benefit offerings for positions other than full-time may vary.

GEICO is an equal opportunity employer. GEICO conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers.

results.name: Senior Network Engineer
results.contents:
Would you like to have a four-letter job? VRRP, e/iBGP, MPLS, OSPF, NPIV and a host of other cool cutting edge technologies will be your responsibility at Red Ventures. We are looking for someone who has a strong networking design and engineering background with Juniper. JunOS certification is preferred. This is not a “pigeon-hole” job where your CLI looks the same as it did yesterday. Our growing company has a dozen things which need your expert attention today leading our network and datacenter operations team – so ping us today so we can route you into our work hard/play hard environment!

Preferred Background:

  • Experience working with JunOS, NX-OS and IOS
  • In-depth hands-on experience working with VRRP, e/iBGP, OSPF, MPLS and similar routing protocols
  • Working knowledge of: Nexus 7K, 5K, 2K; MDS 9148; Catalyst 6800’s (IA – Instant Access); Catalyst 6500’s; WiSM2 Wireless Controllers; Cisco Prime/DCNM; Visio
  • Deep understanding of the following: BGP, OSPF, FHRP’s, SAN networking (NPIV, zoning, etc.), QoS, Network design and standards, VRF-Lite, VDC, Fabric-Path, Enterprise wireless – 802.11g/n/ac,
  • Route-maps/Prefix-lists/ACL’s
  • Aptitude and openness to learn new things
  • Creative and abstract thinker
  • Strong work ethic and a team-player

About Red Ventures:

We’re a team of talented people who think it’s fun to challenge what’s possible and do bold things- fast. Founded in 2000 and headquartered just south of Charlotte, N.C., Red Ventures works with some of the largest brands in the country and we’re now the largest technology-enabled platform in the US for launching and growing sales and marketing businesses.

results.name: Account Director (DACH)
results.contents:
Die Quantcast Deutschland GmbH wächst weiterhin rasant und unser bereits erfolgreich agierendes Account Management braucht Verstärkung. Wir suchen daher einen Account Director (m/w), um unsere strategische Kundenbetreuung weiter auszubauen. Als Account Director (m/w) leiten und entwickeln Sie Strategien für unsere Key Accounts, setzen die tägliche Kundenbetreuung um und führen strategische Kundengespräche auf sehr hohem Niveau. Sie stellen den Erfolg unserer laufenden digitalen Kampagnen sicher und bieten eine erstklassige Kundenbetreuung, um unsere Erwartungen bzgl. der Aufrecht-erhaltung und des Wachstums des Unternehmens zu übertreffen. Sie sind Ansprechpartner sowohl für Kunden als auch für firmeninterne Teams in der gesamten Organisation und sind dafür verantwortlich, die Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Key Accounts auszubauen. Sie arbeiten hierfür eng mit Entscheidern von führenden Mediaagenturen und Direktkunden zusammen.Ebenso stehen Sie in engem Kontakt mit unseren Teams in Dublin und London. Sie helfen dabei, die Quantcast-Produktstrategie voran-zutreiben, indem sie die Geschäftsziele von Kunden erkennen und verstehen, wie Quantcast durch Innovation Wachstum und langfristige Partnerschaften mit Agenturen und Direktkunden erreichen kann. Sie zeichnen sich durch eine strategische und kommerzielle Denkweise aus und nutzen diese, um sowohl das Geschäft unserer Kunden als auch Quantcast voranzutreiben.

Kompetenzen

  • Strategischer Ansprechpartner für unsere Key Accounts auf Entscheider-Ebene (Unit Director, Team Lead, Geschäftsführung etc.)
  • Entwicklung von langfristigen Kundenstrategien, die die Zusammenarbeit mit Quantcast maximieren
  • Verstehen von Kundenzielen und Erstellung datenbasierter Analysen, um unsere Key Accounts hinsichtlich der Erreichung ihrer Branding- und Performance-Ziele beraten zu können
  • Zentraler Projektmanager, der die Kundenbetreuung optimiert und eine reibungslose End-to-End-Abwicklung für unsere Key Accounts und High-Potential-Kunden sicherstellt
  • Up- und Cross-Selling sämtlicher Quantcast-Produkte zur Ausweitung der Marktstellung von  Quantcast und zur Umsatzsteigerung
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Teams zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Arbeitsprozesse für komplexe Kampagnen und Sicherstellung von deren Umsetzung
  • Ansprechpartner für Kunden bezüglich neuer Produkteinführungen und Werbemöglichkeiten
  • Repräsentieren von Quantcast in Branchenorganisationen, Verbänden und auf Konferenzen
  • Führen von regelmäßigen Feedback-Gesprächen mit unseren Key Accounts, um die Zusammenarbeit kontinuierlich zu steigern
  • Zusammenarbeit mit Sales, AdOperations, Kampagnenanalysten und Produktspezialisten zur strategischen Weiterentwicklung unserer Kunden- und Agenturbetreuung

Voraussetzungen

  • Mindestens acht bis zehn Jahre Erfahrung im Umgang mit Kunde im Marketing oder Consulting. Davon mindestens vier Jahre auf Agentur- oder Kundenseite
  • Nachweisbare Erfahrung und Erfolge in herausragender Kundenbetreuung
  • Hochrangige Kontakte zu Entscheidern bei Agenturen und Direktkunden
  • Umfassende Kenntnisse in digitalen und mobilen Medien sowie über die Arbeitsweise von Media-agenturen
  • Umfassendes Verständnis von Performance-Marketing und Branding Solutions
  • Ausgeprägtes Verständnis von Programmatic Advertising und dessen Erfolgsfaktoren (z. B. Attribution, Viewability, Kampagnen-KPIs etc.)
  • Große Erfahrung im Umgang mit Kunden und ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, mit Entscheidungsträger auf hohen Ebenen zu verhandeln
  • Strategisches Denkvermögen gepaart mit der Fähigkeit, interdisziplinär zu arbeiten und interne und externe Stakeholder zu steuern

Quantcast ist ein Technologie-Unternehmen, das sich auf digitale Werbung und Reichweitenmessung in Echtzeit spezialisiert hat. Dafür setzt das Unternehmen auf eine komplett eigenentwickelte Lösung, die plattformübergreifend Zielgruppen analysieren und ansteuern sowie Kampagnen ausspielen kann. Als eines der führenden Unternehmen für Big Data misst Quantcast über 100 Millionen Websites und verarbeitet bis zu 30 Petabytes an Daten pro Tag. Diese Daten aus erster Hand ermöglichen Werbetreibenden, Agenturen und Publishern eine gezielte Ansprache und Messung ihrer individuellen Zielgruppen. Quantcast wurde 2006 von Konrad Feldman (CEO) gegründet und hat seinen Hauptsitz in San Francisco. Weltweit beschäftigt das Unternehmen über 750 Mitarbeiter an 18 Standorten. Die Quantcast Deutschland GmbH unterhält Büros in München und Hamburg.

Weitere Informationen zu Quantcast
·         Web        www.quantcast.de
·         Xing      https://www.xing.com/companies/quantcastdeutschlandgmbh
·         Blog           http://www.quantcast.com/inside-quantcast
·         Twitter     https://twitter.com/Quantcast
·         Facebook     https://www.facebook.com/quantcast/

Kontakt
Quantcast Deutschland GmbH
Leopoldstrasse 23
80802 München

results.name: Retail Sales Manager
results.contents:
As a Retail Sales Manager at PBC, your areas of responsibility would be:

Drives the sales execution and merchandising standards including:

  • Quality distribution
  • Pricing realization
  • Shelf placement and management
  • Display execution
  • POS merchandising
  • Supports chain execution and secondary chain call points where applicable, while closely working with distributor personnel in training and execution of the PBC sales and merchandising standards.
  • Provides the drive towards volume, distribution and visibility ensuring sustainable profitable growth.
  • Lead distributor and retail management through:
  • Visibility- POS Placement/Package/Tap Handles/Shelf Management
  • Promotions
  • Displays
  • Retail Price Management
  • Staff Education
  • Ensure Retail & Merchandising Standards
  • Local & Special Event Activation (Retail)

On and Off - Premise Sales and Merchandising Execution

  • Develops and maintains strong customer relationships at all levels to maximize PBC opportunities for expanded sales execution throughout Key 100 Accounts
  • Drives full portfolio distribution across Key Accounts
  • Drives merchandising and POS execution standards for the PBC portfolio
  • Drives activity and volume output via price special and features negotiation

Consumer Engagement Support

  • Leads National and Local Program Implementation across Top 100 Accounts
  • Drives consumer sampling activities within Key 100 accounts across PBC portfolio as relevant to the Market (on & off-premise)
  • Leads meaningful and impactful consumer interaction that drives local market buzz
  • Oversees all retail activation around community consumer building activities to support the PBC brand platforms
  • Collaborates with the divisional Field Marketing Manager/Representative on local sponsorship and special event execution
  • Supports and amplifies local programming via social media activation in support of key brand activities in the on and off premise

Off Premise

  • Supports the Areas Sales Manager in distribution and executional sell-in crew drives across On and Off Premise (2-3 Days/Month)
  • Assists on key holiday display execution against major initiative and volume opportunities (I.e. Memorial Week, 4th July Week, etc)- Avg. 2 Days Month

Administrative and Recapping Support

  • Leads weekly activity and program recaps
  • Accountable for the Key Account Monthly Sales Reporting
  • Guides local special event and sponsorship process via submissions into Field Marketing Managers
  • Manages local sampling, promotional and T+E budget with accountability into Areas Sales Manager and division Field Marketing Manager

Qualifications

  • A minimum of 2-3 years experience in Beverage with DSD and 3 tier understanding (preferred)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills mandatory!
  • Someone who can juggle multiple projects under tight constraints and still meet all deadlines
  • Looking for a Team Player and someone who enjoys collaborating with others
  • Must be innovative and have a creative way of thinking
  • You must not be satisfied with just meeting expectations but must strive to exceed customer expectations
  • A minimum of 2 years Sales, Field Marketing, Event or Sponsorship experience
  • Strong Local connections to market is preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required to ensure clear and concise communication with management, co-workers and vendors/distributors.
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and Power Point).
  • Bachelors degree required
  • Ability to travel as required.

results.name: Senior Quality Engineering Manager
results.contents:
Senior Quality Engineering Manager

 

ABOUT JIVE SOFTWARE

Jive Software is the leading provider of modern communication and collaboration solutions for business. Our products empower people and organizations to work better together, using technology that adapts to their way – not the other way. The world's best companies depend on Jive to unleash the ideas and impact of their employees, partners and customers.

We're all about working better together inside Jive, too. If you're looking for a fun, inspiring environment where people love their work and do some of the best work of their lives, this is it.

Work better together.

 

THE ROLE

Jive Software is looking for talented quality thought leaders to join our Quality Engineering Organization. As a Quality Engineering Senior Manager, you will be given the responsibility of building and overseeing and automating the quality of Services, such as Search and Analytics, and our Performance team. In this role you will manage a team of technical Test Developers and will work side by side with Development to fanatically ensure high quality products for our customers.

Our Quality Engineering Organization brings engineering talent to the forefront and works closely with development to continuously deliver code to our customers that is reliable, scalable, and functional. We are looking for quality leaders who will help us continue our mission of providing a high quality experience for our customers. Join us at a company that has an award-winning culture that you can stand behind. Come to Jive Software and be a Quality Engineering Jiver! 

This position is located in Portland, Oregon and will report directly to the Senior Director of Quality Engineering.
 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

• Responsible for the quality of a number of Products for our Cloud offering.  

• Accountable for overall design and implementation of testing strategies

• Manage a team of technical Quality Engineers

• Review testing infrastructure and data to ensure proper validation of code

• Follow Agile development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban

• Organize projects through use of quality engineering resource management and development of test strategies that include security, integration, performance and positive and negative functional test coverage.

• Assess and communicate risks based on product complexity, resource and/or timeline constraints

• Use continuous integration and delivery concepts to deliver code to production

• Work closely with development, product managers and support

• Ensure projects are completed on time and according to quality standards

• Ensure projects are completed according to product specifications and are properly documented

• Facilitate communication upward and across the cross-functional project team including project status, justifications for variances and technical information

• Serve as the quality focal point for cross-functional partners on project status or other project information

• Measure and evaluate test progress including results of development test efforts (unit tests)

• Manage personnel activities of staff (i.e., hire, train, appraise, set goals, reward, motivate, discipline, writes performance reviews, recommend termination as necessary).
 

 

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in managing technical Quality Engineering teams working on testing backend systems at the API level
  • 7- 10 years of hands on Quality Engineering or Software Development experience using languages such as Java or Python
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineer related field of study or comparable job-related experience is required
  • Experience implementing test strategies for use with agile development teams
  • Familiarity with Performance Testing
  • Strong knowledge of test automation
  • Ability to work independently, triage issues, and prioritize tasks
  • Strong team player – we are looking for a true collaborator
  • Proven knowledge of Quality Engineering methods, procedures, processes, tools and demonstrated ability to apply that knowledge to testing based on complex test scenarios
  • Ability to build relationships, collaborate with and influence cross-functional teams within your area of responsibility
  • Strong knowledge of cloud computing
  • Strong Leadership skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving, interpersonal, and time management skills
  • Working experience utilizing Continuous Integration concepts and streamlined delivery of code

 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


• Familiarity with advanced software/testing methodologies such as TDD

• Experience working in cloud computing

 

CULTURAL ATTRIBUTES

 

  • Communicator: You possess strong communication skills and enjoy working with customers.
  • Team-Oriented: You are capable of embracing the ideas of others (even if they conflict with your own) for the sake of the company and client.
  • Driven: You are a driven team player, collaborator, and relationship builder whose infectious can-do attitude inspires others and encourages great performance in a fast-moving environment.
  • Entrepreneurial: You thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment and you’re excited by the chance to play a large role.
  • Passionate: You must be passionate about online collaboration and ensuring our clients are successful; we love seeing hunger and ambition.
  • Self-motivated: You can work with a minimum of supervision and be capable of strategically prioritizing multiple tasks in a proactive manner.

 

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

 

Jive has very competitive rewards programs – where your performance will drive your rewards – whether it is cash, equity awards (we provide new hire grants to every new Jiver), or professional development.  Our global JiveWell program spans all of the countries where we operate. In the US, Jivers enjoy healthcare benefits, life insurance, short and long term disability, a 401(k) plan with a Jive match, a Wellness Reimbursement program,  an innovative way for our Jivers to spend time away from the office called Jive FlexTime, and much more.  

 

Jive is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age (if the individual is 18 years of age or older), veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  For more information, please click on the following link:

 

http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf

 

To send a resume and cover letter, please apply online at www.jivesoftware.com/jobs

results.name: Data Infrastructure Engineer
results.contents:
Shopify's platform is expanding at an incredible rate. Along the way, it generates vast swaths of information, which if understood correctly, can lead to far better decisions, and a more successful company. Hadoop powers these critical insights for all levels of decision makers at and building on top of Shopify, and these insights need to be delivered reliably. This is why we're looking to add an experienced Data Infrastructure Engineer to our data engineering team. Please note that all members of the Data Engineering team participate in a 24/7 on call rotation.

You'll need to be:

  • Experienced in planning, deployment, and maintenance of large Linux installations
  • Proficient with configuration management tools, like Chef
  • Skilled with scripting languages such as Ruby or Python
  • Experienced with a variety of open source software
  • Experienced with Hadoop administration: YARN, MapReduce, Hive, Impala
  • Experienced with database administration: query optimization, OLTP and OLAP schema design, hardware considerations
  • Passionate about working on a team: collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals

It’d be great if you have experience with:

  • Apache Spark
  • Data analytics (basic query and report authoring)
  • Cloudera Hadoop Distribution 5 and Cloudera Manager
  • Networking with Arista or Juniper gear
  • MySQL administration and performance tuning
  • Amazon Web Services and Heroku
  • Cassandra or other NoSQL data stores
  • Splunk or other log aggregation tools
  • Working on a distributed/remote team, as the Data Engineering team is distributed across Shopify’s offices

You'll be working on things like:

  • Ensuring that Hadoop stays online, secure, and performant
  • Day-to-day system administration of the production environment
  • Capacity planning
  • Development of configuration management and automation tools
  • Network troubleshooting and monitoring
  • Scalability, performance, and availability of the Hadoop and Spark infrastructure
  • Collaborating with other Data Engineers and Data Analysts throughout your day-to-day activities

Here’s how to apply:

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Yandu Oppacher.

We're a product company and we value those who know our product.
Build a Shopify store if you haven't already. https://www.shopify.com (Don't spend more than 20 minutes on this - it's meant to get you familiar with the product, not to build a professional looking store). Add the link to your store in the last field below.

Note on Title: An alternative title for this job will be "Data Infrastructure Engineering Specialist" if the successful candidate is not a registered Engineer in Ontario.

results.name: Oracle/MySQL Database Administrator
results.contents:
Zapponian [noun | employee of Zappos]. You are self-motivated. You think like an entrepreneur, constantly innovating and driving positive change, but more importantly, you consistently deliver mind-boggling results. You love challenges – the bigger the better. 

Bold [adjective | not afraid of anything]. A role at Zappos is a unique opportunity to be a part of something different. To go bold. To be a part of something exceptional. We’re a company that isn’t afraid to take risks and question the status quo. Oh yeah, we like to have fun too. 

Perks [noun | the good stuff you get for working hard]. Zappos pays 100% of your medical, dental and vision premiums. Primary care visits, dental exams/cleanings, eye exams and generic prescriptions are all free. Pretty awesome, huh?!? Matching 401k, life coaches, orthodontic benefits, and much, much more. And don’t forget, an unlimited 40% Zappos.com discount with delivery right to your desk. 

1990s [noun | a decade we love, but no longer live in]. Old school cover letters are so 1990. Want to show us who you really are? Create and submit a video cover letter with your application. A flash mob, a comedic monologue… whatever showcases your passion and excitement for Zappos and the work you’d be doing! Video cover letters are not required, but if you create it, we’ll watch it.

Position Summary: 

Our team builds, integrates and maintains all of the systems supporting a 1700-person company including the website, warehouse management, order management, and customer service systems. We can do this because each person on our team has the power to make things happen. We have built most of its systems on open-source technology.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and configure Oracle and MySQL database servers
  • Develop and review SQL database designs
  • Secure data and provide for high availability access
  • Optimize SQL for performance
  • Develop/Review/Optimize schema structures
  • Coordinate and implement database changes for in-house code releases and for DB maintenance releases
  • Provide On-call and Operational support
  • Maintain and design replication architecture
  • Refresh QA and Development databases as needed 

Desired Experience and Skills:

  • Excellent knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL. Three to five years of experience preferred.
  • A BS in Computer Science or Engineering (or equivalent combination of education and experience)
  • Experience working on web-based, database driven systems
  • Experience with multiple programming languages
  • Experience with enterprise level high-volume transactional systems
  • Experience with the Shell scripting and Linux operating system
  • Understanding of different storage hardware (SAN, RAID, SSD)
  • DBA Certifications, such as OCP
  • Extensive experience with RMAN.
  • Experience with Oracle RAC, ASM and Oracle Data Guard.
  • Experience with replication tools such as Tungsten or Golden Gate.
  • Experience with large scale MySQL replicated architecture and systems

  If you enjoy the fun and feel of a start-up environment, but also thrive on building complex enterprise systems for an established business, we may be the place for you.  

Relocation assistance is available. Zappos IP, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and drug free workplace.

results.name: SEO Strategist
results.contents:
Why this role is Awesome:

If you enjoy the thrill of increasing rank on thousands of keywords, working fast, and being at a company where the CEO truly “gets” SEO, this role might be for you! 

  • TripAdvisor is growing its world class Search Engine Optimization team and is looking for a SEO Strategist to contribute on strategy, execution, and analysis. TripAdvisor provides a unique, global work environment that captures the speed, innovation and excitement of a startup, at a thriving, growing and well-established industry brand.
  • We take pride in our SEO and are looking for a superstar to add to our high-performing team. 

What Are We Looking For:

  • You are a passionate search marketer who is extremely knowledgeable about best practices and the latest new areas of SEO, and you also relish in the analytical aspects of the industry. 
  • You are detail-oriented, but can balance these details with the larger business objectives. 
  • You are quantitative, pragmatic, and methodical in your approach to SEO.
  • You have relentlessly high standards, and are never satisfied with the status quo.
  • You are invigorated, not intimidated, by large volumes of data and keywords. You are adept at analyzing data at scale.
  • You have deep experience working on SEO on a global scale. You might even speak another language fluently. 
  • You are an ambitious self-starter who takes pride in being “first in class”.
  • You are results driven and have strong business acumen. 
  • You enjoy problem-solving and have a genuine curiosity about how consumers search for information.
  • You work well with many types of people and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • You’re an excellent communicator, especially when incorporating data to substantiate your winning point. 

What You’ll Do:

  • Monitoring daily performance metrics to understand organic search performance across multiple global markets.
  • Identifying growth opportunities in core areas such as site infrastructure, keyword selection, or on-page factors optimization. 
  • Writing specification documents and designing experiments to test new strategies and opportunities for growth. 
  • Analyzing experiment results and pushing forward next steps at a rigorous pace.
  • Performing granular traffic and conversion analyses across multiple global markets to gain insight into keyword and landing page performance.
  • Identifying and analyzing competitor techniques, as well as benchmarking TripAdvisor’s performance against competitors. 
  • Optimizing internal linking structures to maximize rankings across our keyword portfolio. 
  • Assessing and understanding each market’s needs related to Search, and communicating them to various internal and external stakeholders. 

What We Seek: 

  • BA or BS degree (preferred in quantitative field such as economics, mathematics, statistics, or computer science/engineering).
  • 5+ years of in-house SEO work experience with an industry leading website. 
  • Advanced skill with Excel and or Access required. 
  • Exposure to SQL, HIVE, or other coding languages strongly desired.
  • Statistical background is a plus. 
  • Demonstrable track record of business results through SEO. 

Physical Demands:

Must be able to perform customary physical duties and meet appropriate social expectations of a professional office environment. 

TripAdvisor is an Equal Opportunity Employer

***This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization. ***

*LI-BK1

results.name: Associate, Financial Services
results.contents:
About Spencer Stuart

Founded in 1956, Spencer Stuart is one of the largest privately-held global executive search firms, specializing in senior-level executive search, board of director appointments and executive assessment services. Across its 56 offices in 30 countries, Spencer Stuart has a professional team of approximately 600 search Consultants and Associates.

As a private firm, we pride ourselves on fostering a special culture, which is both highly collegial and non-hierarchical – one in which intelligence, insight, excellence, responsiveness, humor, global spirit and interpersonal skills are highly valued.

Financial Services Practice

The Financial Services practice is one of the firm’s largest, most successful, and globally integrated practice areas. Representing nearly one-fifth of the firm’s worldwide client base, the Financial Services Practice is staffed by experienced industry practitioners around the world.

Consumer Financial Services

Our Consumer Financial Services (CFS) practice is one the biggest and fastest growing segments of our overall Financial Services team. The CFS team conducts search work across functions for consumer and commercial banks, credit card companies, and payments companies. Typical searches in this space include CEOs, CFOs, Chief Credit Officers, and heads of business units. The CFS team also does a fair amount of Chief Marketing Officer search work for both large financial institutions, and smaller groups as well. The group has seen particular growth in mobile payments, and digital marketing in the recent past, as firms change how they interact with consumers.

Value Proposition of a Career in Executive Search at Spencer Stuart

  • Advise senior executives on the most challenging leadership issues
  • Develop tailored career platform
  • Operate in a dynamic and fun environment

Position Summary

We are seeking an Associate to support the Consumer Financial Services team within the broader Financial Services group. This individual will work closely with two consultants (Connie McCann and Marie Ford), based in Philadelphia, who do a range of functional work including CEO, board, marketing and digital searches within CFS. In addition, this individual will work with other financial services clients, including private equity firms, asset management firms, and insurance companies.

Ideal candidates for the Associate role include those with strong business acumen, strategic thinking, intellect, judgment and communication/advisory skills. Associates work on multiple client engagements, drawing on project management skills, proactive and quality search execution, an ownership mentality, and strong, team-oriented delivery to specific client needs. Executive search skill sets include strong communication and assessment abilities applied to evaluating business experiences and professional competencies of top executive talent as they relate to a client’s specific need. Associates are expected to develop deep and insightful candidate pool knowledge in the financial services arena.

The position will ideally be based in Philadelphia, but there may be some flexibility for New York City or Washington, D.C. for the right candidate.

Ideal Experience

  • At least five years of business experience in consulting, banking, law firm or a corporate organization, ideally with at least two years in management consulting. Prior experience in executive search is not required.
  • Strong academic credentials; advanced degree preferred.
  • Experience working in a client service environment and/or a role where multiple projects and competing demands are the norm.
  • Demonstrated writing skills.

Please visit The Muse to learn more about the people and culture of Spencer Stuart
https://www.themuse.com/companies/spencerstuart/

Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet

results.name: Architect - Data Model
results.contents:
Are you Mohawk Material? We’re the biggest and the best flooring company in the world, and we are looking for the best Architect - Data Model professionals to support our continued growth! At Mohawk there are always opportunities for high performing Architect - Data Model Professionals to excel! Are you the best? If so show us what you are made of and come build your career with us!

Responsibilities:

This position will be responsible for delivery of enterprise data architecture and data modeling solutions within the Global Analytics COE team. The role will work as a part of a global technology team to create enterprise wide BI solutions. The role will be responsible for establishing and maintaining an adaptable and flexible Data architecture to provide consistent and high quality Data architecture and data models. The position is also expected to provide technical leadership on data architecture, design, and modeling on large, complex BI projects and support in developing enhancements and continuous improvement activities.

  • Responsible for the design of the Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence data models and data sourcing. Ability to lead the design and development of a large-scale data warehouse
  • Comprehensive Knowledge of Data Modeling Concepts including Transaction dimensions, conformed dimensions and facts, slowly changing dimension, multi-Star/ Snowflake Schema Modeling, different types of Fact tables
  • Strong knowledge of principles, techniques, and best practices of data model and dimensional data model, data profiling, as well as prior experience with data modeling tools such as Embarcadero (preferred) or similar is required.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills; Excellent organization skills
  • Knowledge of data architecture concepts such as data cubes and OLAP multi-dimensional systems, data marts, data mining systems, operational data stores, data warehouses, staging databases, and data hubs
  • Experience in Master Data Management, Meta Data Management
  • Experience in modeling for big data and HANA is desirable.
  • Works with Global IS COE colleagues and project sponsors/customers to determine the long-term application architecture and strategy.
  • Provides leadership and development skills to efficiently develop code that can be leverages across multiple sites. It is important to build synergies around development objects for reuse rather than have to rebuild every time.
  • Participates in technical design sessions providing input on best practices
  • Analyzes and provides technical advice and direction with regarding the interface/integrate of supported systems with the rest of the application portfolio; analyzes how the supported applications can best serve business functions; recognizes the impact to the business of proposed applications changes and advises IS colleagues accordingly
  • Documents and maintains best practices, project standards, procedures, application, quality objectives and “lessons learned”; ensures that applications systems are developed in a way that complies with architectural/development standards and established methodologies and practices.
  • Participates on project teams serving as an IT technical expert on strategic long-range and highly complex projects that span the organization, crossing business unit boundaries
  • Performs other duties as required

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering or related discipline with an information technology focus.
- Candidates will need to have led multiple data architecture design in complex BI implementations.
- At least 7 years of hands-on experience on data modeling (Star schema and 3rd Normal form)
- Expert level experience in ERWin and other modeling tools
- 7+ years BI development and architecture design
- At least 5 years’ experience developing Enterprise BI Solution on multiple EDW platforms (Teradata, SQLServer, Oracle, HANA, SAP BW, etc.)
- Experience in integrating and harmonizing complex SAP ERP and non-SAP data sources
- 5 years experience in Master Data Management
- Understand multiple data structures including structure, unstructured, semi-structure, JSON, XML, EDI, etc
- Experience with SAP HANA View creation
- Experience with EDW development life cycle from business requirement gathering to end solution
- Experience in creating semantic layer for Self-service BI and Agile BI development
- Excellent verbal and written communications skills as well as customer service skills
- Exposure to Predictive Analytics, Data Science, and Big Data technology will be a big plus.
- Availability for occasional travel based on client and project needs

Competencies:

  • Excellent oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communications skills; ability to effectively exercise tact, discretion, judgment and diplomacy when interacting and/or negotiating with internal and external customers
  • Ability to present and explain technical information in a way that establishes rapport persuades others, and gains understanding
  • Ability to understand business context/business rules quickly and convert into contextual, logical, and physical data model design.
  • Ability and willingness to accept responsibility, willingness to challenge established practices and draw relevant conclusions, including the persistence and willingness to take calculated risk, to stimulate, market and sell new ideas within the organization.
  • Ability to work effectively in a diverse work group, to achieve results through team efforts, and the desire and ability to motivate, persuade and direct the activities of others.
  • Ability to manage/implement projects and contributes to concept development, and ability to identify, analyze and resolve business issues through solution-oriented projects
  • Ability to perform in a high pressure environment and/or crisis situation and render good decisions to resolve the problems, maintain safety and ensure adherence to Corporate Code of Conduct.

Associates Supervised:

Temporary indirect reporting relationships may exist while working as Project lead. May be require to act in senior role, providing task related advise and direction to junior team members

Normal Office Environment
Occasional Travel

EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Bigelow, Daltile, Durkan, Karastan, Lees, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, Unilin and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, Russia and the United States.

Mohawk Industries, Inc offers a comprehensive compensation package that includes a wide variety of benefit options so that individuals can tailor plans
that are right for him or her. Benefits include health care with a prescription card, dental/vision, disability, life insurance, 401(k) plan with company match, employee purchase discounts, tuition reimbursement for undergraduate and graduate programs and much more.

results.name: Affiliate Marketing Coordinator
results.contents:
Position Type:

Full Time - Temporary

City:

Culver City

State:

California

Travel Requirements:

None

Education Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

Years of Experience:

1-2 years

Certification, Licenses, and Registration:

The primary responsibility of the Affiliate Marketing Coordinator will be to provide high levels of support to the department, affiliate clients, agencies and internal stakeholders by acting as a liaison to ensure proper management, tracking, communication and delivery of creative, assets, promotions, and barter deals are accurate.

This person will be expected to support affiliate marketing; help execute plans to launch priority promotions/on-site activations, and offer up creative solutions to positively impact the department.

Reporting:

  • Reports directly to: Director, Affiliate Marketing

Major Responsibilities:

  • Work with Director, promotional agencies, consumer marketing and affiliate sales on field promotions and events.
  • Provide day-to-day coverage during the season while Director is traveling
  • Maintain up-to-date/relevancy of assets/materials on the NFLN affiliate website
  • Work closely outside promotional agencies
  • Facilitate premiums requests; maintain/track inventory
  • Research and analyze affiliate market data
  • Compile PowerPoint and spreadsheet presentations as required
  • Provide administrative support to Director, Affiliate Marketing
  • Answer affiliate inquiries regarding program scheduling, formats, timings, and asset availability/delivery
  • Track affiliate promotions
  • Maintain affiliate data base to include key personnel, addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, e-mail groups
  • Coordinate participation in meetings, conferences, and prepare necessary collateral.
  • Coordinate affiliate ticket requests

Background & Experience:

The preferred profile would include experience in working on marketing programs with a core competency of moving projects and all the correlating details along from conception to completion on budget and deadline. The priority skill-set requirements suggesting the suitability of an "ideal" candidate for this position would also include:

  • 1-2 years' experience in affiliate marketing
  • On-line, multimedia, enhanced television and/or direct marketing experience
  • Ability to work within the system to get creative and partnership approvals on deadline
  • Event production experience preferred
  • Experience successfully communicating at all levels both verbally and in writing
  • Proven ability to work with all levels of management
  • Proven ability to make sound discretionary decisions while handling sensitive and confidential information
  • Demonstrated ability to multi-task and perform in high pressure situations

Personal Profile:

  • Most importantly, this person needs to be organized, efficient and eager to go the extra mile on any project s/ he is given
  • This person is a creative person who is self-starting and manages projects with minimal direction
  • Ideal candidates possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Equally important, this person must have unquestioned integrity. The individual must share the company's values of teamwork, extraordinary commitment to subscribers, cable operators, advertisers and employees, and the pursuit of excellence in all aspects of their business
  • Someone long on native intelligence and still possessing the appropriate intuition and negotiation skills to adapt to changing market conditions. This person has a high level of analytical intelligence, coupled with a creative questioning approach s/he has the ability to simplify a situation and break it down so that potential problems/ barriers can be identified and addressed
  • A football fan

results.name: Select Account Executive - SLED
results.contents:
The Enterprise End User Computing Sales Specialists within vmware is responsible for a coordinated sales approach with VMware’s internal and external sales team. This extended team is driven to a common goal within a set number of named accounts within the State and Local Government and Education verticals.

The mission of this group is to broaden the reach of all named accounts to ensure the VMware foothold across the entire segment by driving the enterprise product suite of Mobile/Desktop/End User tools into existing and new accounts. Our solution set is viewed as a ‘platform’ within an account and changes the role that IT plays within that account from being considered a cost burden to a strategic services provider that impacts customer business outcomes.

The End User Computing Platform provides its adopters the ability to accelerate their Digital Workspace Journey rapidly transforming Business Outcomes through Workforce efficiencies, Security and Compliance Mandates, and business process innovation.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for selling the End-User Computing Suites: Both the Horizon and Airwatch suite of products and services within a list of Named accounts
  • Responsible for acting as a product specialist to the larger VMware core salesforce and supporting those sales efforts with advanced planning into those Named accounts
  • Drive account portfolio sales strategy and focus on those named accounts and establish sales cadence with the extended account teams
  • Adopt account portfolio sales strategy leveraging multiple channel partners (SISO’s, carriers, OEM, technical, National, boutique)
  • Focus on top tier accounts and collaborate with Inside Sales, Sales Engineering, Business Unit Resources, and Channel partners to ensure complete coverage of entire account portfolio
  • Responsibility to move the account pursuit through the entire sales cycle
  • Provide a Value Match Differentiated with the VMware EUC solution to the customer’s business needs, challenges, outcomes and technical requirements
  • Demonstrate key technical elements of software solution to prospective customers through online web or in-person whiteboard presentations, product (both end-user and IT console) demonstrations and answers feature and functional questions.
  • Develop and manage a Targeted Campaign – Solution oriented into named accounts using a partner strategy by selecting a set of “preferred” partners, develop a collaborative account planning and enable channel partners to be an extension of VMware sales force
  • Accurately forecast license bookings, specific products revenue, servcies bookings on new and existing accounts on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis - Experience Required

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a business or related field with a minimum of 8+ years in Virtual Desktop/MDM/Security/SaaS based technical sales experience, selling into the specific sales vertical
  • 8+ years of experience in related software industry with at least 5 years in a selling role to specific vertical of accounts
  • Experience selling in both a direct and an indirect or channel driven model
  • Experience leading a team of professionals in sales campaigns that include sales executives, field SE’s, Inside Sales, Field Marketing, Services, etc.
  • Proven track record of success selling in a highly competitive environment
  • Knowledge of the high-tech sales cycles
  • Proven track record of expanding revenue in existing territories and establishing new accounts
  • Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales in extended matrix sales organizations with extended sales cycles
  • Basic proficiency in Salesforce.com or similar CRM system highly desired
  • High level of enthusiasm, a strong work ethic, and highly self-motivated
  • Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to exercise effective judgment, sensitivity, creativity to changing needs and situations
  • Must be adaptable, professional, courteous, motivated and work well on their own or as a member of a team
  • Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and challenging workload

Advertised Location (Select only ONE location)

San Francisco, CA, US

About Us

AirWatch by VMware is the leader in enterprise mobility management. With more than a decade in business, AirWatch enables organizations across the globe to securely embrace mobility to thrive in today’s business environments. A pioneer in mobile device management for corporate use, AirWatch simplifies enterprise mobility by empowering IT to manage mobile devices, applications, content, email, browsing and more from a single solution, enhancing business operations and employee productivity across all industries.

AirWatch was acquired by VMware in early 2014 for $1.54 billion and is now a part of the VMware End User Computing business unit. With 2014 bookings of $200 million, AirWatch by VMware has more than 15,000 customers, the broadest ecosystem of mobility partners and 2,000+ employees in 11 offices around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value innovation, passion, integrity and our customers. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on building the next generation of mobile technology? Learn more at air-watch.com/careers.

EEO Statement

VMware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions, which include: recruiting and hiring, selection for training, promotion, rates of pay or other compensation, transfer, discipline, demotion, layoff or termination. VMware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, family medical history or genetic information, citizenship, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, military status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. VMware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law. Further, it is the policy of VMware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment.

results.name: Bilingual Tour Consultant
results.contents:
Bilingual Tour Consultant
EF Educational Tours Canada
Toronto, ON


The Company: 

EF Educational Tours offers international learning opportunities designed to provide students with firsthand exposure to the world’s cultural, historic and natural sites as they study them. For more information, visit www.eftours.ca.

Who We Are:

  • We’re travellers, innovators, thinkers and doers
  • We help teachers and students discover the world
  • Open and collaborative - not a cubicle in sight
  • We’re global - we have offices and schools in over 50 countries
  • Dedicated - we really do believe in “work hard - play hard”
Who You Are: 
  • You are bold, unconventional and fearless - a true entrepreneurial spirit
  • An influencer - a natural networker who loves talking to people
  • Excellent, persuasive communication skills in both French and English. 
  • You know you can sell and you’re not afraid to prove it
  • You have a hunger to find and develop new business
  • You want to be part of a team that motivates and inspires you
  • Going above and beyond is the only way you do things 
The Opportunity: 

As a Bilingual Tour Consultant on the Inside Sales team, you are responsible for selling educational travel and driving the growth of the company by calling out to educators within a region to consult on our travel itineraries. Your role will focus on generating new business, reaching out to lapsed group leaders, responding promptly to inquiries and convincing educators why travelling with EF is the right decision. You will work collaboratively with the sales team, promoting all EF product offerings, while ensuring all promises are followed through with and met. 

EF offers a fun, energetic, and competitive environment that supports and grows its team members through leadership development, training, coaching, mentoring, and travel opportunities. With a progressive business model and a strong vision for continued growth, EF is currently looking for Bilingual Tour Consultants to enhance its Canadian sales division. Learn more at www.ef.com, www.eftours.ca, andwww.ef.com/careers.


Qualifications: 

• Must be fluent in French and English (verbal and written) 
• Desire to work in a fast-paced customer focused environment 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
• Driven, self motivated and competitive 
• Ability to plan, organize and establish priorities to meet goals and achieve results 


You Can Expect: 
  • To earn a competitive base salary and bonuses
  • Outstanding vacation time:  3 weeks in your first year, 4 weeks in your second year
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits, as well as a company matching RSP plan
  • Training and professional development opportunities 
  • Frequent sales competitions with amazing rewards
  • Paid international travel at least once a year!

EF Educational Tours Canada is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. EF Educational Tours Canada will accommodate disabilities during the recruitment and selection process. Should candidates experience accessibility issues with any pages on the career site, please contact EFCanada.HumanResources@EF.com for assistance. Please note that application submissions and other inquiries are not accepted through this email address.

results.name: Sales Trainee
results.contents:
Entrepreneurial spirit, innovation, internationality, creativity, flexibility and passion are the success factors of our company’s history and continue to define our corporate culture and every single one of our employees. Find out more at www.ef.com/careers.

For our sales offices in Basel, Bern, Luzern, St. Gallen and Zürich we are looking for Trainee-Sales Coordinators as of August for the duration of one year.

Trainee - Sales Coordinator

Your responsibilites:

You will have a variety of responsibilities ranging from the sale of our language courses via the phone, online and in person, to administrative tasks and some marketing activities:

  • Sale of and consultations for language courses abroad: by phone, in person and online
  • External representation of the company at fairs and infomeetings
  • Conception of new sales ideas and strategies
  • Continuing development of the sales region
  • Partial responsibility for the sales success of the entire team
  • Assistance in the implementation of marketing projects

Your profile:

  • Native language Swiss German with good English skills
  • Higher education (Uni/FH/HF) in tourism, business or communications is a plus
  • International experience in the form of an exchange year or a language stay abroad is an advantage
  • Strong interest in sales, especially over the phone and through personal consultations
  • Structured and well-organized way of working
  • Open, communicative and team-oriented personality
  • Fast learner and efficient at daily tasks
  • Steadiness of mind even in stressful situations

EF offers its staff a varied, creative and dynamic work environment, which promotes teamwork and a positive atmosphere in the office as well as individual development opportunities. Our employees are communicative, enjoy their work and strive for further professional development, which EF supports through trainings as well as trips to discover our schools abroad.


We are looking forward to receiving your application in English or German.


About us

We are 40,500 staff, faculty and teachers, working in 500 offices and schools across 53 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 50 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education.

Located across the globe, our language centers for youth, adults and professionals combine the best of traditional, in-school teaching with innovative language-learning technology. We offer intensive language instruction abroad in English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Japanese and Chinese. Courses run from 2 to 52 weeks for students traveling independently or in escorted groups of all levels and abilities. Classes take place in our international language centers in one of 16 countries and offer the very best locations and accommodation whether in local host family or in a student residence.

results.name: Associate Solution Architect
results.contents:
Looking for an awesomeAssociate Solution Architect to join our team!

Responsibilities

  • Access the needs of client and develop a consulting statement of work and price proposal for integration and standard implementation of Cornerstone software
  • Identify and discuss options for integrating historical and third party data into the Cornerstone Talent Management solutions
  • Create standard implementation proposals and statements of work for Midmarket clients
  • Manage a high volume of support requests from the Cornerstone sales and service teams, to scope and document services statements of work.
  • Engage Customers on scoping calls, Q&A calls, and general relationship building in the context of client acquisition or expanding an existing client’s use of Cornerstone Technology
  • Continuously learn and adapt new solutions and ideas and improve customer experience and success
  • Think outside the box - bring new ideas forward in a positive, proactive way

Required Skills and Experience

  • B.A. / B.S. in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering Management or equivalent degree
  • Two years’ work experience in technology, cloud computing, business process or professional consulting services
  • Excellent writing, communication and analytical skills are imperative
  • Grasp and communicate abstract concepts and ideas and clearly articulate written and oral solutions
  • Proven ability to focus, work effectively and independently and meet deadlines while calmly dealing with competing time projects
  • Ability to scope, analyze, propose and deliver solution complex technical integration and business process integrations
  • Outstanding service-orientation and strong interpersonal skills that create positive relationships with colleagues and clients
  • Ability to travel approximately up to 20% of the time
  • Experience and knowledge of Single Sign On security is a major plus
  • Fluency in multiple languages is a major plus
